column1: '''''ëalar''''' is a [[Quenya]] word which referred to such [[Spirits (creatures)|spirits]] who did not require a body in order to be complete (like the [[Maiar]]). ''Eälar'' are contrasted with ''[[fëar]]''
column2: which are the souls of beings whose natural state is to be incarnated in a body.<ref name=MR>{{MR|P3I3}}

column1: The word is related to Quenya ''ëala'' ("being")
column2: <ref name=MR/> and seems to be related to the Quenya verb ''[[Ea (verb)|ëa]]'' "be

column1: It has been suggested that ''-la'' is the present participle ending of verbs (cf. "-ing"; but Quenya ''-la'' only forms adjectival participles)<ref>[[Helge Fauskanger]]
